messages: d85362faae75ddbec33d4870191c72e9 (21:59): hello
d85362faae75ddbec33d4870191c72e9 (22:00): please, where could i find the canvas spec ?
d85362faae75ddbec33d4870191c72e9 (22:00): http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/#the-canvas remains silent
150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64 (22:00): "remains silent"?
d85362faae75ddbec33d4870191c72e9 (22:00): empty page :)
150ca666565bfcb850b2e2ee3c0f0c64 (22:00): not for me
d85362faae75ddbec33d4870191c72e9 (22:01): really ?

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:01): http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/section-the-canvas.html#the-canvas might work better if your browser doesn't like really big pages
e46c339b9a8e8603453f5ec2a1f50f91 (22:01): Yeah, works for me too.
d85362faae75ddbec33d4870191c72e9 (22:01): i just get an html page with an empty body
d85362faae75ddbec33d4870191c72e9 (22:01): i'm using firefox
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:01): (Works for me too :-) )
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:02): (but the multipage one works quicker)
d85362faae75ddbec33d4870191c72e9 (22:02): very strange
d85362faae75ddbec33d4870191c72e9 (22:02): surprisingly ie7 displays it
d85362faae75ddbec33d4870191c72e9 (22:02): well thanks for the other link
d85362faae75ddbec33d4870191c72e9 (22:03): while i'm at it, is there a way i could make a canvas element have the same size as the client area of the browser window ?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:04): Is it adequate to rescale it with CSS, or do you want the bitmap dimensions to change too?
d85362faae75ddbec33d4870191c72e9 (22:06): well i'm trying to make it have the same size as the client area, then i want to draw something inside

73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (22:07): btw, do sites rely on image maps being css pixels rather than following the size of the image? i've found 1 site that doesn't work correctly because of this behavior
d85362faae75ddbec33d4870191c72e9 (22:07): i tried <canvas style="width: 100%"> but firefox keeps giving me a 300px wide canvas
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (22:07): http://sodertalje.se/ when you change the text size
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (22:07): the banner at the top
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:08): d85362faae75ddbec33d4870191c72e9: I'd expect that to give a 300x150 bitmap which is rescaled to 100% of the width of whatever
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:08): If you want to change the bitmap's size, you need <canvas width=... height=...>
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:08): or set canvas.width=... etc with JavaScript
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (22:08): or rather, Isac Lagerblad found it
d85362faae75ddbec33d4870191c72e9 (22:09): you mean drawing happens in the 300x150 space then it's interpolated ?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:09): d85362faae75ddbec33d4870191c72e9: Yes (since the bitmap's default size is 300x150 if you don't specify width= anywhere)
d85362faae75ddbec33d4870191c72e9 (22:11): ok i did not know bitmap's default size was 300x150
d85362faae75ddbec33d4870191c72e9 (22:11): i'm new to this
d85362faae75ddbec33d4870191c72e9 (22:11): (to canvas)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:12): http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/section-the-canvas.html#width3 is where the default sizes are defined
d85362faae75ddbec33d4870191c72e9 (22:12): gonna try to play a bit with javascript to adjust the size then

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:13): It might be useful to know that the canvas gets reset to its default empty state whenever you resize it, which might be a pain if you're making it dynamically resize to fit some other object
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:14): wonders [in a completely unrelated direction] if anybody actually likes/uses server-side image maps nowadays

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:15): I get the impression that they were much more popular when HTML4 was being developed, so it was more worthwhile trying to handle them accessibly; but now anybody who cares about accessibility won't be using server-side image maps at all
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:19): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: I use quite frequently a service that uses server side image maps without using ismap
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:19): dunno how they do it

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:19): http://aikataulut.ytv.fi/reittiopas/fi/?mm=trip&sm=&m=&adv=&map=1&n=&a=8411&b=8127&c=&keya=Kuusitie%252525252525252010&keyb=Karvaamokuja%25252525252525204&keyc=&an=10&bn=4&cn=&date=20070815&time=2216&params=1l3l1l3l2l2ll1l1l1l1l1l0&temp_a=2550006%2C6676237&temp_b=2549061%2C6678598&temp_c=&time=2216&date=20070815&which=&px=2547000&py=6679334&ppx=&ppy=&zx=2545666&zy=6670268&zoom=1&width=600&height=400&route=t0a2550006a6676237t0a0a0t9a183a90t1a35b20t9b
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:19): that's an example
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (22:21): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: I don't see the example image map

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:21): That mostly just says "Valitettavasti paikkaa/reitti?§ ei voitu n?§ytt?§?§ kartalla." which I guess translates to "sorry, there isn't an image map on this page" or something similar :-(
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (22:22): do we have to be logged in or something?  Or have some cookie?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:22): hmm. wfm. cookies or something, I guess

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:23): try http://aikataulut.ytv.fi/reittiopas/en/?keya=pasila&a=17816&an=&bb=17838%3At1a2551837a6673309%3AKamppi%3A740%3A&bn=&keyb=kamppi&hour=22&min=23&vm=1&day=15&month=08&year=2007&va=2&adv= and one of the show route links

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:24): It's odd how <a href=.><img usemap=#m ismap></a> in IE appears to send 'click' to the 'a' (in areas not covered by <area>s), but then doesn't actually load the page after you've clicked on it
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (22:24): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: I clicked show route from that page and got the map
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:25): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: so the map is in practice a server-side image map
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:25): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: but in HTML terms, it is not
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:26): That's just an <input type=image>
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (22:26): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: yes it is.  It uses <input type=image src=...>, which sends the x,y coords when click
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:27): whoa. I'm really bad at viewing source then
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:27): used Firebug -> Inspect :-)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (22:28): checking the HTTP request headers revealed the &x=00&y=00
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (22:28): XRAY would have helped too
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:34): Bah, I can't find anything crazy or inconsistent about how Firefox and Opera handle <input usemap> :-(
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:35): Oh, except that Opera applies it to type!=image inputs too
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (22:36): I tested non image inputs yesterday in Firefox hoping to find a bug like that.  I should have checked opera
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (22:46): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: have you filed a bug report?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:48): Hmm, I'm not actually sure it is a bug
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:49): HTML4 appears to say that INPUTs with 'ismap' must have type "image", but it says nothing about usemap

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:50): (<input usemap> seems to just be covered by "The MAP element specifies a client-side image map (or other navigation mechanism) that may be associated with another elements (IMG, OBJECT, or INPUT)." which doesn't even make grammatical sense)

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (22:59): if I were to narrow down the selection for the 3 forms task forms members, I'd have to go with at least 1 or 2 (if not 3) of these people: Hixie, Maciej, Anne, Matthew Raymond and maybe Ben Boyle
